unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Linear Transformation
question_text:
The random variable $X$ is normally distributed with mean $28$ and standard deviation $9$. The random variable $Y$ is defined by $Y=4X-7$.
What are the mean and standard deviation of $Y$?

choices.text: The mean is $105$ and the standard deviation is $9$.
The mean is $105$ and the standard deviation is $29$.
The mean is $105$ and the standard deviation is $36$.
The mean is $112$ and the standard deviation is $29$.
The mean is $112$ and the standard deviation is $36$.

solution:
We are dealing with a linear transformation.

Since the mean is measure of center, the new mean will be:

$$4X-7$$

$$=(4)(28)-7$$

$$=105$$

Since the standard deviation is a measure of spread, the new standard deviation will be:

$$4X$$

$$=(4)(9)$$

$$=36$$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice ‘A’ is incorrect as the standard deviation gets multiplied by $4$.

Choice ‘B’ is incorrect as the standard deviation will not get subtracted by $7$.

Choice ‘D’ is incorrect as the mean will get subtracted by $7$, but the standard deviation will not.

Choice ‘E’ is incorrect as the mean will get subtracted by $7$.
